name: Ensure MFA is configured with strong factors
body: While adopting MFA is a great step forward, some factors are safer than others. As you might imagine a code (OTP) sent through SMS or email, which is still prone to phishing attacks, is considerably less secure than a biometric factor for example.
remediationDescription: Consult the [Okta documentation](https://help.okta.com/en/prod/Content/Topics/Security/mfa/about-mfa.htm) and, depending on your security requirements, disable certain factors from the **Authenticators** page and/or edit the rules of your authentication policies from the **Authentication Policies** page.
